original_title: Civil Aviation Authority to host ‘Sri Lanka Aviation Day’ in collaboration with IATA
original_body_lines: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) has announced its collaboration with the International Air Transport Association (IATA) to host ‘Sri Lanka Aviation Day’ on 14 July at the Auditorium of the Authority.
This knowledge-sharing event aims to revitalise the aviation industry in Sri Lanka, which has faced unprecedented challenges due to the global COVID-19 pandemic.

With the world slowly recovering from the pandemic, there is a renewed sense of optimism and a collective determination to rebuild and grow the aviation sector. ‘Sri Lanka Aviation Day’ has been conceptualised with this vision in mind.

The event provides a unique platform for industry leaders, policymakers, and stakeholders to come together, explore challenges, and identify opportunities for recovery and sustainable growth in the industry. Through a series of panel discussions, keynote speeches, case studies, and networking events, participants will delve into crucial topics that are pivotal to the industry’s resurgence. The significance of ‘Sri Lanka Aviation Day’ lies in its potential to unite key stakeholders and foster collaborative efforts to rebuild and strengthen the aviation sector. Industry leaders, policymakers, and stakeholders will share valuable insights, exchange ideas, and develop strategies that will contribute to the sustainable future of Sri Lanka’s aviation industry.
